snippet: The drug maker said it would delay seeking approval for an experimental osteoporosis drug, an announcement that helped send the company’s shares down 3 percent.
abstract: Merck says it will delay seeking approval for an experimental osteoporosis drug, an announcement that sends shares down 3 percent on the same day it announced its fourth-quarter earnings for 2012; fourth-quarter profit was $1.4 billion, or 46 cents a share, compared with $1.51 billion, or 49 cents a share, in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The drug maker said it would delay seeking approval for an experimental osteoporosis drug, an announcement that helped send the company’s shares down 3 percent.

headline.print_headline: Merck Delays Application for Osteoporosis Drug
